reviews.text: I've been here twice now and neither times disappointed.  They wee fairly busy on Sunday when we got here, so service was a bit lax. Food is phenomenal.  I had buffalo wings and sweet potato fries. The Buffalo sauce was a bit on the light side, so I'd recommend asking for some on the side. Also had the Cuban coffee which was amazing. Definitely will be coming back when in D.c.

The place is very nice and pleasant, outside seating area seems a better option since inside there is no AC and only fans so it is noticeably hotter. I loved that they had oat and almond milk to substitute whole/skim for cappuccino. The hash brown is nicely cooked - crunchy and in a square. If they were to have booths inside the place I would give it a 5 star. But amazing as they have a bar inside too. Prices aren’t as expensive as other restaurants that I visited nearby. The waitress was extremely nice and talkative to us.(:

Open City is one third of a Greek-owned Diner trilogy. All three spots are solid for good food at a fair price. Very Casual.  Full Bar. No set vibe -You will see all types of people as a situations when you walk in. Always friendly service!

Coffee and Tea options have a gravity all their own within the Menu; the selection is as interesting as it is diverse. I strongly recommend the Dirty Chai (I ordered mine with a shot of Vodka- why not!?).

I have yet to encounter a menu item that is even remotely unpalatable. I will say Breakfast is their strong suit, especially for Dinner!  :)

Such great service from Mark 2 mornings in a row! The first day I got the steel cut oatmeal and the second day I got the stuffed French toast with a cappuccino. So delicious! My friend got the open city royale, which she loved. Meals are $10-15 on average.

I was attending a conference down the street and needed lunch before it started. I was seated at table for 1 outside under the tent. The food was great but the waiters were so overwhelmed it gave me anxiety. I almost didn't order something because they were panting from running around. I think they were short staffed or maybe the crowd was larger than expected? Either way, they did their best but it wasn't the best dining experience for me.

Had a lunch meeting here with a colleague and was really hoping to each lunch. However, I was told that the restaurant didn’t carry mustard which was a bummer. I got the banana nut muffin instead and it was really good. Tryst definitely has the sweets down. My  Golden Milk latte was really really good as well. My colleague, who’s a regular here, ordered an iced latte with lavender which he really enjoyed. Personally, this is a spot for hot or iced bevs and pastries, but the food menu left much to be desired.

Great spot.

Went here for the first time at night after dinner. We got tea and a slice of Carrot Cake. All was good.

The interior is really nice. Super 90’s cafe vibes. I will for sure come back to work as there is ample space and multiple types of seating (coaches, two-tops, counter).

The staff is super friendly and overall it was a great ending to a good evening.

Cute place with great coffee & a limited menu. Unfortunately, our visit was painfully SLOW. Sat at the counter, it took 15 min for someone to take our order & another 10 to get coffee. Had to walk over to our server and ask him for a to go box & our check, we could have easily just walked out...no one was tracking anything there & I'm guessing it happens. Lox & Cream Cheese Everything Bagel was good, heavy on the lox & red onions, the lemon cream cheese & the bagel itself were very good.

My sister and I popped into Tryst in the evening for hot chocolate and carrot cake (which were both huge and tasted great). It's wonderful to have a place to go in the evening that's not a bar, even though they do serve alcohol. Service is also prompt and digital, with dine in or take out options. One of my favorite places in DC!
Very nice atmosphere. I had Turkey Club Wrap with chips. It was good, I would appreciate more seasoning either in the Wrap or on the meat. All over a great experience.

Food was WONDERFUL! Only reason for the 4 stars is the service was extremely slow. Make sure you get the hot n juicy sauce for your meal. We got baby and it was plenty spicy. It’s the best! Fried brownies were ok. Would be wonderful with ice cream!

Although the food is great. The service isn’t. My wife and I had to wait over 20 minutes to just be seated while these 3 tables sat dirty and not cleaned. We could’ve been sitting there the entire time if they took the time to bus the tables for us instead of making us wait for no good reason. We had to pull an employee aside to ask if they could clean the table for us to sit down at. We traveled an hour just for the food, so at least we could be seated in a timely manner.

I love going to hot and juicy because the food is really good. I was there on 8/02/22.  I was sat all the way to the back corner table where the bathroom was located. I didn’t really mined because like I said the food is always good here.   I sat there for 10 minutes and I still didn’t get any service. One of the server finally got to me and I told him that I was ready as soon dropped the menus. I ordered 1 pound of shrimp , 1 pound of crawfish with rice and 1/2 of sausage and a lime beer. My food finally arrived but it was missing the sausage. I was trying to get the server’s attention but he never came back. I saw  him and the other servers going to others table and asking them if they need anything but never circled back to me. I finally finish eating my food and still no sign of any servers until a tall white guy/shift supervisor asked me “how was everything here”,  I replied by telling him that nothing was good because no one came and asked if I needed refill on my water and or my beer. I had also told him that I could have easily walked out and they wouldn’t have notice. He’s excuse was that they were transitioning to dinner and different servers. THAT Should never be an excuse!!!
From now on, I will only order food Togo.

Ehhh, I don’t know lol! I live in Louisiana so try to avoid these types of places in other states. When we arrived, there weren’t many guests and it took a long time for us to be seated. In my opinion, the prices for the boiled seafood were outrageous (based on how much the others paid). I played it safe and ordered a shrimp poboy. The shrimp were really small and the sauce on it was weird. They should have just kept it simple and it would have been “okay.” One thing that turned me off was that there were gnats flying around the restaurant. Overall, I know good seafood and this isn’t it. I cannot recommend this place!

I came here with 3 friends for our first time trying crawfish. The food was delicious and the portion sizing was respectable.

The staff is very kind and friendly. They remembered our names throughout the 2 hours we were there, which added a loving feeling.

The seafood bags come with a variety of seasoning and spice options - even if you can’t handle a lot of spice, you can still have a well seasoned meal.

Overall, I recommend this place and my friends and I plan to come back sometime after the holidays :)

If you looking for the baddest of drag brunches, my b*#%€$ is the baddest. The show kept moving on and the positivity was flowing. The food was good. There’s a portion of the drag that gets emotional and had me crying. It was all love in the drag. Will be going back again. Love is love. We all prosper.

We went to the Drag Brunch today and it was AWESOME! Good food, good drinks, some of the most amazing and charismatic performers I've ever had the pleasure of seeing. The amount of happy energy from the dancers and the audience was even more intoxicating than the alcohol!

I mean, I cried. It was that much of a wonderful time. We went here for Perry’s Drag Brunch (Top Drag Brunch in the Nation by the way) and had theeee Best time!

Food is in a buffet style. Everything was seasoned and tasted amazing. For Brunch (3) ladies performed and the phrase “Take My Money,” will never be the same again. We loved the atmosphere, music, performances, food and everything else.

Come here at LEAST 20 minutes early to find parking. Bring cash or bills to exchange please. Really can’t express how great of a time it was. Awesome staff/management team and really beautiful atmosphere.

I’m definitely going again. Also, Congratulations to the Performers who were celebrating their Birthday and upcoming Wedding, respectively. It was beautiful meeting you all. Encourage anyone and everyone to go.
Value for money. Has a great variety of options, not the highest quality of Japanese food. The Happy hour has great value. Got the Omakase sushi.

Extremely tasty, elegant and not too expensive. Walked in on a Sunday evening, wasn’t expecting much but the place surprised me: it is nice, service was great and everything we ordered, especially the food, was delicious.

tl;dr: Subpar falafel bowl, but amazing fries and curry ketchup & long service time for "fast food".

Falafel Bowl - 3/5: Falafel was kinda dry, and also drenched in sauce. The pickles and other toppings were not bad, but I couldn't shake the feeling that other established chains just do it better for bigger portions.

Fries - 5/5: These steak fries were delicious and perfectly fried and crispy even after my drive home as a takeout order. And I wasn't expecting the ketchup to elevate the fries to a whole new level. I'm glad I took the recommendations to get fries at a falafel shop! I would go back just for the fries.

Service - 3/5: Just felt like the cashier didn't want to be there and it was very quiet. They blocked off where the food is assembled due to covid, which is acceptable, but I wish I could see my bowl being assembled and seeing the toppings instead of just hoping they were good enough. Also there was only 1 person in front of me, and it took what felt like 15-20 minutes to complete my order. I was looking for something quicker.

Quirky spot with good falafels.

I was looking for a light, refreshing meal on a Tuesday night. This place didn’t disappoint.

The falafel bowl with everything was good. A bit pricey considering the size of the bowl, but quality over quantity.

The fries were a bit meh. It comes with curry ketchup which is an interesting twist. A pleasant surprise.

Overall, a good place for a light meal. The interior decor is unique. It’s worth stopping by.

It was fine, but just fine. Falafel Inc is way better in terms of overall flavor, and the sauces they provide are way better, but this shop excels in all the free toppings so it's a good go to for quantity, but not quality.

I got the regular falafel sandwich loaded with hummus, baba ganoush, pickled cauliflower, pickled cabbage, tahini, and the red pepper sauce. It was a formidable creation but just lacking any standout flavor.

Their fries were just fries, and I didn't find the curry ketchup anything to write home about.

Friendly service, and great decor. Love the Amsterdam style, including all the old school music call outs including the Fugazi poster.

Oh, and they really want you to mask here, and have lots of funny signs to remind you.

A bite to remember!
I’m a big fan of falafel, and here was just great! Price is reasonable and u have many great choice to add to your falafel with no extra charge.
Also it’s located in one of the coolest street of dc occupied with bars, cafe n restaurants.

When I was in town and looking for sone quick lunch options and wanted to have veg thus when found this place. Got to see many accolades from different journals saying this is one of the best falafel place.. I took falafel sandwich and my friend took falafel bowl. The pita bread was soft , falafel was flavorful and their tahini tastes so yumm .. I would definitely recommend this place though inside theres not much place to sit however they’ve outside sitting area as well

Ok breakfast food. Loved the concept of local ingredients though! Nothing taste-wise stood out this visit but it was all good and we would be willing to try other items as the sandwiches next to us looked amazing!

Great local spot for a quick bite, prices pretty average. Atmosphere relaxed.

French toast has chicken served right on top
Of it.  Mushy and lack of flavor in French toast.  Chicken is tender but also flat flavor.  Onion rings are burnt and lack flavor.  Looks like the kind you buy frozen and fry.  Soda machine broken.  Milkshake was delightful, sweet and creamy! All of the tables are peeling finish on wood tops.  The bench seat upholstery is cracked and peeling.  All the vents in the top of the dining room are fuzzy with dusty ick.  The waitress and host are very nice.  Too bad the food isn’t as stellar as it could be, such a good trendy location and updated historic location.
Willy at The Diner was so awesome! Excellent customer service. The fish tacos and cherry blossom shake were amazing! Got a table outside in the shade. Very satisfied, will definitely be back!

I'm a professional hitman and a hearty, nutritious meal is an important part of my regimen. Right up there with cleaning my gun. Anyway, I always stop by The Diner for some good eats and some friendly banter with my fellow hitmen colleagues. Great crowd; nobody likes hanging around with a bunch of stiffs. I always order the Monte Cristo, because who doesn't love a ham and cheese sandwich on French Toast? Yum. Anyway, the waitstaff is great and I love the old style booths. Lots of privacy, which is important in my line of work. 👍

Went to this place while visiting DC with my boyfriend. The food was amazing and the service was even better! Our waitress (wish I could remember her name) was awesome and very accommodating. Will definitely visit again when I’m in DC!

I visited Mama Ayesha’s for a friend’s birthday and it was a great experience. The food and ambiance were great. Every dish had the perfect amount of seasoning and flavor. We went on a Tuesday night, and there was only one other party dining while we were there.
Overall, the experience was great besides our waiter who was a bit rude. He walked away from us while we were ordering on multiple occasions which rubbed me the wrong way. Either way, it’s worth a visit.

We payed around $300 for a group of 8

Great atmosphere and service. The atmosphere is quiet and peaceful, and leaves plenty room for conversation. I got the Arak, Mashawi and Arabic Coffee to end with. Each meal left me wanting more. Although the portions are relatively smaller, the flavors are refreshingly authentic. For those from a middle Eastern background, it will take you back home. Highly recommend!

I had a bad experience in this restaurant, first of all, the toilets are broken and very bad. Secondly, the food is not enough even for one person. Thirdly, when I paid the bill, the cashier took the credit card from me and went behind the cashier. He has no right to do that at all. Finally, I was surprised that he put a tip on his own without consulting me or even giving me the choice of the amount of the tip, and he has no right to do that. If you want to waste your time and money go to them.
Food was ok, what you would have expected it to be and that all.
First time to try but not last, I like the malfofo mahshi and maklobah very delicious and fresh. Thanks

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Definitely recommend!

Such an atmospheric place in a nice lively area close to Metro! The food is great, I had Borscht and then the Chef special Beef Pot Roast&Mashed Potato. Everything was amazing! Honestly, I don’t think I have ever eaten such delicious beef! 😋
It’s my new favorite restaurant in DC!
Will definitely come back soon with friends and family!
BTW, it’s a perfect place for private events as they have a huge space on the second floor.

Phenomenal experience at New Heights. This place is a a true gem. The crab cakes tasted better than ones we had on the Chesapeake Bay. The food was great, but the drinks were even better! Cocktails had unique flavor profiles - definitely go for happy hour, the prices are great. Gunchin and Katya went above and beyond. We will be back.

We had a great time at the restaurant! The service was very personal and the recommendations from the staff were on point! The food was all cooked to perfection but the real hidden gems of the restaurant are the s’mores and a well curated wine list. I can’t wait to go back!

New Heights Restaurant in Washington DC is a place that should not be missed! The food was incredible - I highly recommend ordering the fresh oysters, lamb chops, halibut, and Branzino. Not only does it taste amazing, but the presentation of every dish was also outstanding. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, providing excellent service throughout our experience. There’s a great energized atmosphere without being overly loud. Highly recommended! #five-stars #newheightsrestaurant #washingtondc

My wife and I went for lunch here while we were on vacation and was very impressed with this place I don't write many reviews but I had to give recognition to new heights we started with the tuna poke tacos and where blown away with how tasty it was I also had the steak sandwich with truffle aoli very delicious. Also the cleanliness of the bathrooms and restaurant itself tells you they hold a high standard for quality.
Will definitely be back

I ordered a chicken bowl with extra meat and was given LITERALLY 10-15 pieces of chopped chicken (I counted them for her) THE employee was so rude and disrespectful that me and my son declined to purchase the food. This happen to often at Chipotle that I found a spot on Wisconsin Ave N.W named SOL MEXICAN GRILL with great customer service, good quality & quantity food, and better prices. This was my LAST time dealing with this at Chipotle ✌🏾

I love Chipotle but lately every Chipotle I have went to are becoming more expensive and move stingy when it comes to food. The amount of food that is put in the bowls are ridiculous. Before the prices went up they gave you more food and now that the prices have went up the amount of food is terrible that they place in your bowl. I will not buy another bowl or burrito from them. If others stop supporting them as well then maybe they will do right by the customers. I refuse to spend any more money with them just to get a kiddie size meal for that expensive food.

To be honest I got a steak bowl, it was the VERY VERY bottom of the pan, the STEAK was sooo dry I really didn't enjoy it, I had to load it up with sour cream just to get some moisture in it, I normally only use a tiny bit of sour cream...

We had a rice bowl here. It was delicious and filling.

The Mexican chain is situated at a bustling Street of Washington surrounded by multiple restaurants.

Here you can get burritos, wraps , rice and salad bowls.
The costs range from $ 4-10.
Vegetarian and non vegetarian options are available.
Although the food is NOT halal.

It's a self service place and the food is fast moving.
Pick from a variety of meats, types of rice, vegetables, guacamole, toppings and additional suaces.

You can also get a juices and sodas to quench your thirst.

The rice bowls are huge so don't take too much if you can't eat it.

My wife and I had been to the zoo the morning we ate here for lunch and had worked up a pretty good apatite. We wanted to eat lunch before we caught the Metro back to Arlington for a visit there. Wow the portion size at this Chipotle compared to the Chipotle`s back at home in Alabama were way bigger. I got a chicken bowl and my wife got a chicken quesadilla and my bowl was overflowing by the time I got done and all I ordered on it was rice, chicken, queso, and cheese. This by far was the best Chipotle experience that I have ever had.

My go to sushi delivery in dc! The rolls are fresh and well packed and it’s a good value. I especially like the shrimp tempura roll and angry dragon roll. The sashimi is good quality too! Highly recommend Umi!

Pro tip: if you’re ordering for more than one person, put their name in the notes of the rolls they’re ordering and Umi will group them together.

I was really craving some good sushi!!! That being said, my favorite is Uni. I called around town and finally found a place that had california uni sea urchin. I ordered 1 Unagi ( Eal ) Nigiri, 2 Uni (Sea Urchin) Nigiri, 2 California Rolls w/ Dbl Tobiko & 1 Avacado Roll. My belief was that I could sit down and have a really nice early dinner with my mother. Incorrect, I couldnt, my bad I guess I shouldve asked, but really It should've been told to me by the hostess when we spoke on the phone. Anyway, I decided to go ahead and do take out. The lady at the door was very kind and explained the whole COVID thing, OK fine you get a pass, that was my thought process. We received our to go order within 15 mins or so. Astetically, everything seemed to be fine. However, as soon as I ate my first peice of Uni I knew immediately that it was spoiled. So was the rest of the Urchin, badly. So spoiled u could smell it upon closer examination. The eal was lackluster but edible. Then I got to my California Rolls. The first two peices were edible, however the third had spoiled artificial crab meat. DO YOU KNOW how long it takes for that protein to spoil.??? A VERY VERY long time.! I wasn't even going to write a review, but I'm sorry I paid something like $70 for sushi I literally shoveled up in my arms and threw in the trash. How absolutely disrespectful and dangerous to serve spoiled UNI to my elderly mother and I. Dishonorable is all that comes to my mind. SMH

Easily one of my favorite sushi/Japanese restaurants in DC.  Near the National Zoo by the Woodley metro this is a true neighborhood gem with great quality with fresh ingredients and they do not hold back on the meat, plus friendly staff.

I’ve been coming to this place since 2014 and each time I dine or carry out food they do not disappoint.
Ordered 3 rolls (spicy salmon, spicy tuna, and volcano) - all were terrible. All appeared to contain only imitation crab - no real fish in any. Huge disappointment.

First night visiting DC, we came to Umi.  Overall, it was a good experience.  The service was not exceptional, but not bad, either.  Our appetizers were delicious, and the entrees were fairly good.
I had chicken fried rice, which was good but needed some special sauce (I stole my mother's) and had a few too many onions for my taste.  My dad had sashimi, and he liked most of the fish on it.  My mom had the chicken katsu, which she really enjoyed.  Salads were dressed with a very interesting dressing that started off sweet and ended smoky.  The highlight was definitely the appetizers, though. We had pork gyoza, which was the perfect balance of chewy and crispy.  We also had rock shrimp, which were delightful.  Extremely crispy with a strong umami taste and a touch of heat at the end.  Highly recommend them.

This is the beast place! We sat for dinner, the atmosphere is amazing, they have good drinks too. The prices are very good for the portions that you get and it’s delicious. The staff is also very helpful and polite. If you are in the aria I recommend!
Great authentic Irish bar in NW DC. Excellent for New York Giants games. Very friendly bartenders who know everybody almost like family. Enjoyed my beer and a Reuben! Fun to be there.

We arrived around 10:50 pm and were looking for something to eat. We asked for the hot dogs and were so happy with the choice. They were amazing. The service was really good as everyones was very friendly and the atmosphere was so great. Music was also fantastic.

The best watering hole in the area. Great place, knowledgeable owner on sports related material, he knew more about my countries sports than I did! Also the only place the a pint - that's 20 ounces not 16 - a proper British pint.

The best place in Washington D.C. for fried pickles.  If you are a fried pickle aficionado, you know how hard it is to find a restaurant that makes them correctly. Seriously though, the staff is friendly and great. The atmosphere is lovely. The menu is what you expect from an American-Irish pub. If you are in the area, stop in and have a bite.

Delicious ramen with about 15 options including Korean style, vegetarian, chicken, beef and classical pork options. They ask what spice level you want from 1 to 10 and as a person used to a lot of spice, I would 8 is pretty spicy for me. Definitely recommend.

Service is reasonably quick but it is a popular place, so you might have to wait a bit to get a seat, especially if it is more than 2 people.

Really solid ramen spot, I got the DC Miso Ramen with extra bamboo shoots and it really hit the spot but it was a bit light on the portion but I guess Ramen isn’t a super filling food to begin with. The restaurant itself is a little confusing to find, but it’s located underground and was a little humid, but that’s probably due more to the weather outside than the A/C inside. Would definitely come back!

Good Tonkotsu Red ramen. The broth is delicious and the chashu was tender. The pieces were a bit thick / inconsistent cut and the noodles were just a little over cooked.

Overall, though, the flavors were great and the portions perfect. Orion can of beer to compliment.

Also, really good music vibes. They were playing Tribe when I entered. This basement level restaurant is a great environment. To chill and slurp noodles.

I’ll be back.

Best ramen in town. The owner was very friendy and helped us decide what to get. We wanted to try them all and we had no regrets. Jus a heads up, spicy is ranked 1 to 10(10 super spicy)  ,a 5 is really spicy it would actually be a 7 or 8 in my book. But thats jus me. Loved all the food. Especially the kim chi which is the owners moms recipe😃

My favorite ramen place in D.C.
Raman is just perfect, and they are not shy with their portions. The appetizer buns are perfectly cooked, it just melts in your mouth. The service is excellent. The chief came outside and greeted us.

My favorite rooftop bar in D.C., offering unbeatable views of Adams Morgan. I love the frozen margaritas. I'm taking one star off because they kicked us off the roof to host a private event. Can't speak on the quality of the food.

We went on a Friday night when it was very busy at surrounding restaurants and bars. To my surprise we got in immediately and sat right away. We had a nice window seat and could look down and see the street and nightlife. The online ordering system was easy to navigate. After ordering drinks, they were almost instantly brought out. The food soon came and was piping hot. The burger was delicious and cooked to the perfect medium rare. Great vibes and service. Huge drink selection including draft beer.

Came here with a friend on a Wednesday night for trivia. It was seat yourself and there was plenty of room. Even after trivia started, there were still tables available. I ordered the sourdough grilled cheese with tomato soup. The soup was a tiny portion, but the grilled cheese was delicious. I also ordered the wheat beer on tap, and was able to try other beers up at the bar. Overall it was pretty good, maybe would try something different off the menu next time.

My experience at this establishment started out alright, but went downhill real fast.  I am not going to give only 1 star because one of my complaints is regarding the volume, but that is not really the bar's fault, it just means the night was busy.  It started off well because we all got right in, and the bouncer was polite.  Because it was so loud, I needed some air and to take a walk so I asked the bouncer if I would be able to come back.  I understand it's possible to reach max capacity, which is why I had him clarify to me that I would be allowed right back in.  I was with friends, so it was a bit important that I had this information.  The bouncer even said if someone else is here, show them your ID and you will be good.  I came back after my walk and yeah you guessed it, two other people were there and refused to let me in.  I explained the situation above in how I made sure I would be allowed back before leaving, and they both said I was just lying.  It was a he said she said at this point, so the argument was pointless.  I should have been informed by the staff when I clarified what I was doing that if I did leave, there would be a chance that I could not get back in right away because of max capacity.  I begin to walk away and the bouncer is like “hey sir you want to wait in line”? I said no thanks as I did not want to be there anymore.  I informed my friends of what happened and we all just ended up leaving.  Unfortunate for a tourist as this was very unwelcoming and hostile.  I would like to be treated with respect, and not to be lied to.  This is why people at bars often go nuts screaming and causing a scene.  Lucky for them, I was polite and let it go but I could absolutely see a drunk person going off because of this.  Next time that happens, remember this..... A little respect and uhhh not lying could go a long way.
Awesome place for groups! We were 15+ in our table, service was fast and delicious. You order by your phone so each person has their own tab. No need for venmo or multiple credit cards at the end.

Absolutely fantastic happy hour (shhhhh don't tell!) $4-5 boozy drinks and $2 per 2 pieces of nigiri! That fish tastes fresh and sizes were decent. Excellent customer service even tho they were busy. Highly recommend
The food was amazing, we loved the Sushi, soup, Ramen, and Noodles dishes. Would love to visit again. Wholesome food.

Been coming to Tono for a few years now, usually for the Happy Hour Sushi. The price has gone up from $1 to $2 for certain items, but is still quality.  The restaurant, at one point, did have two floors, but since reopening after COVID generally just see the downstairs open.  Very friendly staff and large selection of sushi, noodles, appetizers or main entrees. Great little spot about a half block from the Woodley Park Metro.
Our sushi was fresh and delicious. Staff was super friendly. Went for the $1 nigiri on happy hour which is a great deal so I’ll definitely be back!

Loved it! Me and two friends stopped by this place for their happy hour deal. We definitely weren't disappointed, and honestly it made us want to come back. When you think happy hour sushi, you usually think the leftovers, small portions,  and not fresh. For sure not the case with this lovely place which means their other food is just as great. Can't wait to stop back and try out their ramen!

name: Spices Asian Restaurant And Sushi Bar
vicinity: 3333 Connecticut Avenue Northwest STE A, Washington

reviews.text:
Spices is a great local Asian restaurant located a half block from the Cleveland Park Metro.  As a vegetarian that have great tofu options including tofu fries with delicious spices and my favorite, Bali Tofu (pictured).  It is seared and has a delicious peanut based sauce.   Everyone who has eaten here with me and orders anything from noodles, chicken, beef to sushi has always enjoyed the dishes. Can get them spiced to your comfort.

Great spot if you are in the area, fresh and quick turn around time.

So-so at best. The food is really salty and sweet, over seasoned and as a Korean I can surely say this is not authentic Korean or Japanese food. My server didn't even notice we didn't have a QR scan code until we had to ask for a menu. The sushi (cold food) came after my hot plates were already finished (why exactly..?). I lived in the area for about 4 years now and I recently made my first visit; probably will not return because the prices are high and the food is mediocre. Btw what you are seeing in the pic is $20+.

I'm from Texas. This was one restaurant we tried that was really good. I'd definitely consider a safe go to when visiting DC. I found other places to be overly spicy and lacking flavor.  That was not the case at Spices. Yum!

Yes. This food is good. The sushi is very, very satisfying. I got 6 pieces of Nigiri sushi, a spicy salmon handrolled piece, and the vanilla mochi ice cream... and it was all very delicious.

The dishes had beautiful presentation, the fish had a lovely bite and texture, the rice wasn't overly dry like you might find with grocery store sushi, the handrolled piece had a lovely layering to each bite, and it was all just very good. It's a pretty plain opinion from me about this: this place has great sushi.

The mochi ice cream was also treated with respect: in terms of its presentation and my enjoyment of it.

The restaurant itself was fairly open and spacious. There were many small tables, to one of which we were seated. I didn't check the bathrooms, unfortunately, so I can't comment on cleanliness or maintenance. Overall, however, the place seemed well kept and generally well treated.

I really have no complaints, from my perspective on the sushi itself. The server was courteous and checked in from time to time. She accidentally gave us the wrong receipt at the end, but thankfully I checked it before she realized.

This is a simple review. Excellent sushi. You pay per piece, if you want Nigiri, otherwise pay by the roll or entrée. I hope my included pictures help entice you to try this restaurant. I recommend everything pictured, and hope to come back for more in the future.
5/5 stars from me.
Every item we ordered was absolutely delicious.  The presentation was fantastic as well.  Sashimi was great, and my udon was perfect. I'll definitely come back.

When you see a restaurant that has been around for over 20 year, you know it is good. I had never tried Brazilian food before so everything was surprisingly good to the first-timer. They have a special lunch menu if you go in the right time. And for about $26 per person, you get one appetizer, one entrée, one desert, and one drink. The fish stew and pork stew were really delicious.

Excellent service, great menu options and perfect for large groups.

We were a group of 10. We made it more family style. We ordered multiple tapas and 8 entrees. It was enough to share. We came in hungry and left very satisfied. We also brought our own wine. It was a $15 corkage fee.

Feijoada-deli-delicious and generous portions.
Cheese bread-yumm!
Brazilian Paella-different, but tasty
Steaks- it had a good flavor but wasn't very tender.

We pretty much ordered everything on their menu. I'm just stating the standouts from our evening. It was our daughters's bday, initially they passed out the dessert menu only to take it back and bring a huge baked Alaska. Enough for everyone at our table to share!

It's the little things that make come back :)

During restaurant week in DC, my brother and I tried this place and we were glad we did. This was our first time in an authentic Brazilian restaurant and we loved every dish. Our server recommended dishes and drinks most authentic to Brazil and we enjoyed all of her suggestions. The flavors married very well and the meats were marinated and prepared well. The menu selection for the restaurant week was pretty big and the price was very reasonable. I would definitely come back here again! Here’s what we ordered:     Bolinho de Carne
Picanha Biro
Brigadier de Colher Com Amendoim (melted chocolate bar)

Caldo de Sururu
Churraso Misto
Pudim de Leite

Holy hell this place was seriously fantastic! The atmosphere was relaxing and made for a great intimate/romantic dinner. Camila made sure we had a great anniversary celebration. She recommended multiple dishes on the menu - all of which were extremely delectable. She also had assistance from another woman working at the restaurant who’s name I unfortunately do not remember but also provided incredible service. This was our first time but will not be our last. You can’t go wrong with any item and please order the passionfruit mousse with the Brazil liquor poured on top! Camila clearly deserves recognition and a raise based on our experience alone.

In my wanderings,  I randomly chose this place for supper. It is situated on the edge of what seems a pleasant,  vibrant neighborhood and I enjoyed people watching while I ate. It seemed a popular location. Many people arrived and were greeted in a very friendly manner.

I started with a Brazilian lager and a spicy mussell soup (sopa de surura). It arrived hot (& spicy) with a nice presentation. It was very tasty! The portion size was just right - not too filling but not too small to make me feel the price was high.

The main was underwhelming. I had the salmon verde. The salmon was a tad dry and didn't really reflect the sauce. The asparagus and white wine sauce, on its own, was tasty. I wish the salmon had taken on the flavor.  The potatoes were okay, a bit underseasoned for me. The sautéed vegetables were... boring.

Overall,  the food was satisfying, but the service was a bit slow. I wasn't in a hurry but felt a little ignored, being a table of one. I'd bring back friends but maybe not have the salmon again.

The spicy mussell soup is recommended!

Lillies was not only yummy, but the service was fantastic, even with it being NYE and only having 2 wait staff(that I saw). Everyone really enjoyed their meals: lobster raviolis, chicken Marsala, Tour of Italy, and the lamb! The lamb was some of the best that I have had in a really long time.
If my review was helpful, follow me and you’ll get updates on what I think about the places I visit!

Such a huge fan of Italian food and this did not dissapoint! Love the fact that you could taste how fresh the food was. Also love that it’s a small family owned restaurant but also very intimate setting. Only gave a 4 because when we arrived service was a slow but then we were rushed when the restaurant was closing. Overall great food and good pricing. The tiramisu was also made fresh so I loved it!
Great place, the food was fresh, hot and delicious. It was a great atmosphere. I'll have to try the panda Pancakes next time. The service was really friendly and the drinks were really good.

Exploring DC was especially amazing when our Driver recommended LiLLiES for brunch and it’s location to the Smithsonian Zoo. My boyfriend is in the restaurant industry and enjoyed the creative signature cocktails, service, and the fact that I could order Panda Pancakes!

We had a great event at this location.  we held a program anniversary celebration for approximately 40+ people.  The set up worked well.  The staff was professional, the food was excellent.  Ryan was very easy to deal with and the communication was frequent and easy.  The only draw back and it is the same with many DC venues was parking. Nothing the staff can really do about that so not marking them down for it.  Great place for an event

name: Eddie's Cafe Chinese Cuisine
vicinity: Talpalar Building, 2600 Connecticut Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text:
Solid Chinese food - I had the chicken and vegetables, and it comes with hot sour soup. Not greasy, full of flavor and well worth it. Hot and sour soup is soooo good. I could have a pint of that and be happy.

Food came out in under 5 min - packaged well for take out. Love this place
So good, large portions and so cheap!! They also deliver for only a dollar. Really really awesome. I got the chicken fried rice and hot and sour soup.
It was ok, nothing special about their Chinese food.

I used to get takeout here for years. Food was always half decent, if you know what to get. Then one time I saw the lady at the register take what was left of the soup that she was eating and pour it into another to-go container. She then packaged it into a brown paper bag with the rest of the order and send it off like nothing happened. She tried to hide behind the plastic so I wouldn't see, but that obviously didn't work. Needless to say I haven't been there since, but I wonder how many times I ate someone's leftovers.
Kung pao chicken was pretty tasteless, just sugary. Definitely not ordering this again. Will update my review in future if I try other things.

Food and atmosphere were to notch. During a crowded DC night, this was a nice low-key place to been with hookah, great drinks, and good energy.

I would recommend the hookah simply based on the prices in comparison to other locations.

The process of having multiple waiters got a tad bit confusing, but there was always someone to help us!

Recommendations: Calamari, Baked Salmon, and Lamb Sliders

it’s definitely THE PLACE to go! The music is good, place is sooo beautiful and the hookah is perfect ! I keep this address and will share it with my friends. I love everything ! No regret ❤️
You have to see upstair.. wonderful Moroccan place I feel in Morocco ! Thank you for this moment and thank you to the manager

Went for a going away party for a friend and  the atmosphere overall was pretty nice. Loved the music it was just a bit crowded for me. There were about 4 or 5 other parties of various sizes upstairs which didn't help. The drink I ordered had to be remade but only because the menu didn't state there was lemon juice in it.  It was way too sour and from what I thought it was the only drink that did not have lemon juice in it.  Had to wait a really long time for our waitress to come take our order but that may have been a result of how extremely busy it was in there.

It's honestly really good. The hookah tastes great but the reason I am giving it four stars instead of five is because it is so wildly over priced. I understand that hookah is more of a unique commodity in the States but their prices are unreal. Also, the prices on the menu are not up to date and we were charged marginally more than we anticipated from the menu.

Employees were rude and the bartender was bad. Strange employees also talking to us when we didn't want to talk to them. A customer was trying to get her watch back and the bartender and amit would not give it back. The manager / owner?  had no idea what he was doing. Overall sketchy bar, hookah was ok, but weird crowd and staff ruined this bar.
